About The Mag

VJs Magazine is an international open-sharing web magazine which deals with audio visual art forms and creative technologies. It was launched in April 2013 by founder Guillaume J. Lauzier. It is accessible to anyone who wants to share, is passionate about or just has a general interest in live audiovisual performances and creative technology. It offers daily news about upcoming and past projects, a section for learning with recommended books and courses, technical reviews and tutorials, interviews with top artists. Check upcoming events in your area with a interactive calendar, anyone is welcome to share through the different forms available on the Submit page.

Submitting Content

We accept articles, videos or projects, product release information and your app to review, upcoming events or festivals and workshop postings, competitions and vj contest, your reviews and interviews under certain conditions, about new creative technologies, relevant school courses, partnership proposal for cross-promotion and even your help by simply sharing on the submit form. This is not a promise of success, part of your contribution will be a statement on our mag and information for other contributors to read, and you’ll have your own profile with your posts and social profiles attached too! We want you to be a part of it, creativity is something we share.

About The Content

Content on this site is licensed under a Creative Commons License – Attribution 3.0 Unported (CC BY 3.0). You are free to to Share — to copy, distribute and transmit the work, to Remix, to adapt the work and to make commercial use of the work under the following conditions: Attribution — You must attribute the work. Please attribute to VJs Magazine stating the source of the article including the url.

About User Submissions and Comments

Whilst we try to moderate all user comments and submissions VJs Magazine can not be held liable for opinions expressed by users. Not all software that is submitted has been tested by VJs Magazine team so should be downloaded with caution. We make all reasonable effort in checking information and to ensure the accuracy of content provided by us, no responsibility can be taken for any error or omission. VJs Magazine reserve the right to refuse access to the website, terminate accounts and to remove or edit content.

Links to other websites

This website contains links to other websites that are operated by third parties. VJs Magazine does not accept any liability over the content of these third party sites. The existence of these links do not constitute an endorsement of such websites, and your linking to these sites is at your own risk.

Privacy Policy

VJs Magazine request personal information from you if you decide to sign up with us. This information includes a username, password, your real name and your email address. Other information you provide us with is optional but will be requested if you are purchasing hard goods. The information you provide to VJs Magazine is confidential and protected to the fullest extent possible. VJs Magazine does not share this information with any third parties with the only exception as may be required by law. VJs Magazine uses “cookies” to help with the login process and to track site usage. This information is anonymous. We use this information only to improve the functionality of the website.
